pageContext.claim: “I look at the numbers we send them -- we send them massive aid and they're pouring drugs into our country and they're laughing at us.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. directs an average of $320 million worth of aid to Mexico each year. Trump, however, fails to acknowledge that the largest portion of that aid goes to law enforcement — including counter-narcotics efforts. The Mexican government is in not supportive of the drug cartels and there is no reason to believe they are "laughing" at the joint efforts to curb the drug trade.
